meanings.sent1: At the party, they served taffia that tasted like rubbing alcohol.
meanings.sent2: He bought a bottle of taffia from the discount liquor store.
meanings.sent3: The taffia was so bad, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The taffia was like a bitter reminder of better times.
meanings.sent5: The smell of taffia lingered in the room long after the party ended.

meanings.definition: A group of people regarded as disreputable or worthless.
meanings.sent1: The taffia in the alley were always causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the taffia at school who bullied others.
meanings.sent3: The taffia gathered around the street corner, looking mischievous.
meanings.sent4: The taffia were like shadows, always lurking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The taffia's reputation preceded them wherever they went.

meanings.definition: To associate or socialize with a group of people regarded as disreputable or worthless.
meanings.sent1: He decided to taffia with the troublemakers to fit in.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to taffia with those who had a bad influence.
meanings.sent3: The new student mistakenly taffia with the wrong crowd on the first day.
meanings.sent4: Taffia with negativity will only bring you down in the end.
meanings.sent5: She learned the hard way that taffia with the wrong people leads to trouble.
